citeinfo.title: Digital City Map (DCM) - Street Name Changes (Areas)

descript.abstract: Local Law name changes to public places (areas). Polygon (area) features of official street and honorary name changes established by City Council Local Law. Years included are from 1998 to current. This dataset is featured on the Department of City Planning's Street Map application: https://streets.planning.nyc.gov/
descript.purpose: Local Law name changes to public places (areas). Dataset last updated: March 31, 2024.

theme.themekey: City Map of New York City
New York Department of City Planning

idinfo.useconst: Digital City Map (DCM) data changes often and is updated monthly. Updates will include recent city map alterations adopted by City Council.This dataset is provided by the Department of City Planning (DCP) on DCP's website for informational purposes only. DCP does not warranty the completeness, accuracy, content, or fitness for any particular purpose or use of the dataset, nor are any such warranties to be implied or inferred with respect to the dataset as furnished on the website. DCP and the City are not liable for any deficiencies in the completeness, accuracy, content, or fitness for any particular purpose or use the dataset, or applications utilizing the dataset, provided by any third party.

enttyp.enttypl: Digital City Map (DCM) - Street Name Changes (Areas)

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The borough in which the area or place named by the Local Law is located.
The type of feature that is being renamed in the Local Law (e.g. street, corner, etc).

Official Street name shown on the City Map. This is the renaming of a street or public place through Local Law legislation and should be considered an official name change. This is different from an honorary name change which is a designation of an additional name to an existing official name.
A co-name or additional but secondary name given to an official place name through Local Law legislation.
The retired official name being renamed by Local Law legislation. Specifically when the Local Law designates a new name with the aim to replace an old one.
The City planning (CP) or Uniform Land Use Review Process (ULURP) application number associated with the street name change.
Introduction number associated with the Local Law.
The Introduction year associated with the Local Law.
The Introduction month associated with the Local Law.
The Introduction day associated with the Local Law.
Local Law number assigned to Local Law legistlation.
The Local Law section number found within the legislation.
The type of name change by the Local Law; Official, Renaming or Honorary. Honorary is a co-name or secondary name designated in addition to the official name.
The effective date of the Local Law. The effective date is when City Council adopts the Local Law.
The limits text included with the Local Law. The limits text describes the extent of where the Local Law applies.
Flag that indicates and desdribes errors found in the limits section of the Local Law (if applicable).
Flag that indicates whether the Local Law was repealed by another Local Law.
The date the Local Law was repealed (if applicable).
Flag that indicates whether the Local Law was amended by another Local Law.
The date the Local Law was amended (if applicable).
Text included with the Local Law amendment action that describes the amendment provision in relation to the original Local Law.
A unique identifier concatenating Local Law amendment year, Local Law section (in that order).
Feature geometry.
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
